alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 31 at 2:34PM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... .A major storm system will move into the region Monday with precipitation becoming widespread during the late afternoon and evening. Due to the expected track, parts of southeast Minnesota and northeast Iowa are at risk for a heavy wintry mix of precipitation; icing of a tenth to three tenths of an inch and accumulating snow. * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Late Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning: Ice accumulations of one tenth to three tenths of an inch possible. Tuesday: Light snow accumulations. * WHERE...Portions of north central Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely should these ice accumulations develop. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening and morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There remains the potential for this storm to shift north or south. Travelers are urged to keep up to date with the latest forecasts and statements concerning this potentially hazardous travel situation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
